metadata.title: CVE-2016-5699 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the HTTPConnection.putheader function inurllib2 and urllib in CPython (aka Python) before 2.7.10 and 3.x before3.4.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers via CRLFsequences in a URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5699` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.10~rc1-1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.10~rc1-1
python2.7 - 2.7.10~rc1-1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.10~rc1-1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.10~rc1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.10~rc1-1').
